uninitDerivedMemberVar.description:
Description

Member variable 'classname::varname' is not initialized in the constructor. Maybe it should be initialized directly in the class classname? Member variables of native types, pointers, or references are left uninitialized when the class is instantiated. That may cause bugs or undefined behavior.
uninitDerivedMemberVar.option:
Static analysis does not have options.

Severity: warning
CWE: 398
Inconclusive: false
Related Symbols: classname::varname
